New Records: Boston Celtics made a record-tying 29 3-pointers in a single game.
Key Match Events: Jayson Tatum scored 37 points and made eight 3-pointers.
Jaylen Brown added 23 points and had 10 assists.
Jalen Brunson scored 22 points for New York.
Karl-Anthony Towns had 12 points and seven rebounds.
Pre-Game Insights: The Boston Celtics raised their NBA-most 18th championship banner to the rafters before the game.
Post-Match Reflections: The Celtics led by as many as 35 points before missing their last 13 3-point attempts while trying to break the record.
The TD Garden crowd chanted 'Yankees Suck!' with the Celtics leading by more than 20 points early in the third quarter.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Celtics hit their 29th 3-pointer early in the fourth quarter, then missed 13 attempts in a row from beyond the arc as they went for the record set in 2020 by Milwaukee.
The crowd chanted 'One more 3!' in the final minutes, but on Boston’s last possession Payton Pritchard dribbled out the shot clock without making another attempt.
Others: The Celtics visit Washington on Thursday and the Knicks play their home opener against Indiana on Friday.
